title: UniCredit Outdoors Eazzlife
text:
17 August 2015 10:39 CET UniCredit Outdoors Eazzlife By Daily Guide 
Sakyi-Hyde, CEO of uniCredit after launching the product 
UniCredit, one of the leading savings and loans companies in the country, has launched an asset finance product Eazzlife to provide financing to customers and non-customers, who wish to acquire electronic and other home appliances. 
Emmanuel Tetteh Quaye, Head of Client Services, briefing media on the sidelines of the launch of the product at the corporate head office, said the product was launched in direct response to the needs of the numerous customers of uniCredit. 
'We have gone through a series of research and customer insights and have developed this unique product with specific features and flexibility that will tackle the yawning gap between those in the formal sector and the informal sector,' he noted. 
Touching on the unique features of the product, Mr. Quaye said 'Eazzlife,' unlike other existing products on the market, would offer convenience in payment. 
He emphasized that 'Eazzlife' comes at no additional to the customer. 
Customers will pay the exact price as displayed on the shelves of the showrooms. 
He said uniCredit is determined to provide customer centered, value driven, innovative products and services through high technology to its customers. 
Mr Quaye said clients, whether in the formal or informal sector, can access Eazzlife at any of the 13 networked branches of uniCredit. 
UniCredit is one of the fastest growing savings and loans companies in the country with a network of 13 branches in Accra, Kumasi and Takoradi.
